channel.title: Netbeans help
channel.description:
so i am trying to dump my cache. but when i use it in netbeans, it says: [code]java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server/server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server.server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247) Could not find the main class: server.server. Program will exit. Exception in thread "main" Java Result: 1[/code]
Since i can't edit the compiler, i cant add -cp . behind the code. How do i fix this error without addign the - cp?

item.title: Netbeans help
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“202685, post:4, topic:432963”]u dont need -cp crap… thats if your compiler isnt in the same folder as the .java files
just put this

“C:\Program Files\java(JAVA VERSION)\bin\javac.exe” *java[/quote]

the last word should be *.java

Read full topic

item.title: Netbeans help
item.description:
@202685 wrote:

u dont need -cp crap… thats if your compiler isnt in the same folder as the .java files
just put this

“C:\Program Files\java(JAVA VERSION)\bin\javac.exe” *java

Read full topic

item.title: Netbeans help
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

Honestly, i hate IDE’s so i have no clue why you can’t edit a compiler. But the thing is, the cache dump didn’t come with a compiler and he specifically said use netbeans/eclipse to compile. So, yea.

Read full topic
